div.l: Thee Melnere smilede of theyre nicetee
And thowghtte all this ne is doon but for a wyle
They wenen that no man may hem begyle
But bee my thryfte yit schall I blere here Eeye
For all here sleyghtte in here philesophie
Thee more queynte krekys that they make
Thee more wille I stele whanne I take
In stede of flowr I wille geve ham bren
Thee grettest clerkis been nowt wyseste men
As whilum to thee wolf spakespkespake thee Mare
Of here arte cowntte I nowt a tare
Owt att thee dore hee gooht well previly
¶ Whanne that hee sawe his tyme full sotelly
Hee lokede vp and down till that hee hath fownde
Thee clerkis hors theer as hee stoode bownde
Bee hynde thee Melle vnder a levesell
And to thee hors hee gooht feyire ⁊and well
Hee strepyht offe thee bridell ryght a noon
And wanne thee hors was lows hee gynnyht goon
Towardis thee fen there wyilde Maris Renne
And foorht wᵗith wehe thorghw thicke ⁊and thenne
This Mellere comyht agayn no word hee seyde
But dooht his note ⁊and wᵗith thee clerkis pleyde
Tille that here corn was feyre ⁊and well grownde
And whanne thee Mele was sacked ⁊and bownde
This Iohn gooht owt and fynt his hors a weye
And gan to crie harowe and welaweye
Owre hors is lost aleyn for goddis bonis
Step on thy feet cvm owt man attonis
Allas owre wardeyn hath his palfrey lorn
This aleyn all forgat bothe mele ⁊and corn
All was owt offe his mynde his hosebandrye
What whilk way is hee goon gan hee crye
¶ Thee wyif com lepyngge inward wᵗith a ren
Schee seyde allas yowre hors gooht in the fen
Wᵗith wyilde Maris as faste as hee may goo
Vn thank come on his honde that band hȳm soo
And hee that bettir scholde have knitte the rayne
Allas qduod Iohn Aleyn for cristis payne
Lay a down thy swerd ⁊and I wil myin also
Iohn is Full wyght god woot as a Roo
By goddis hertte hee schall nowt skape vs bathe
Why ne hadde we put the capull in the lathe
Yll hayill by god Aleyn thow is a fonne
This sely clerkis haven full faste I Rvnne
Towardis thee fene bothe Aleyn and Iohn
And whanne thee Mellere sawe that they were gon̄
Hee hath half a buchsschell of here flowr I take
And bad his wyif go knede it in a kake
Hee seyde I trowe thee clerkis were afeerd
Yit can a Mellere make a clerkys beerd
For all theyre art now lete hem goon here waye
Loo where they goon yee lete the children pleye
They getyn hit nowt so lyghtlye be my crown
¶ This sely clerkys Renne vp and down
Wᵗith keep keep stand stand iessa warderere
Gaa whistell thow and I schall kepe hym here
But schortlye tille it was verray nyght
They cowde nowt thow they doon all here myght
Here capul kacche hee ran alwey so faste
Tille in a dyche they kawghtte hym at the laste
Wery and weet as beeste is in thee Reyn
Comyht sely Iohn and wᵗith hym comyht Aleyn
Allas qduod Iohn thee day that I was born
Now are wee drevyn to hethyngge ⁊and to skorn
Owre corn is stole men wille vs follis calle
Bothe thee wardeyn and owre felawis alle
And namelye thee Mellere welawey
Thus playniht Iohn as hee gooht be the wey
Towardis thee Melle and bayard on his hand
Thee Mellere sittyngge by the fyre hee fond
For it was nyght and ferthere myghtte they nowght
But for thee loue of god they hym bee sowght
¶ Offe herberew and of ese as fore here peny
Thee Mellere seyde a gayn yif theer were eny
Swich as it is yee schall haue yowre part
Myin hows is streyt but yee have lerned art
Yee cvnne by argementtis make a place
